description: So much included that you'll only have to pick up bait and you'll be set. Its a well kept 2 man poly boat, original name is ~Basstender 10' 2"~ long with nice comfy leather seats, upgrade from original plastic seats on a NICE adjustable boat trailer with no rust and working lights. 7.5hp 1970 mercury outboard motor, and a minn kota electric trolling motor. Marine 12v battery with DieHard charger. 2 adult life jackets, 3 kids jackets. anchor, oar, bait net, ropes, aerated live well,  and I'm sure theres other gadgets I'm forgetting. The pre-wired lights in the boat don't work, didn't work when I got it, just had to be sure to have my own lights at night and be careful. Legal stickers on it through 09/17. Other than the electric there is nothing negative or nonfunctioning included with this, its a turn key package lots of fun for you and a buddy or easy to dock in and out by yourself. Sorry I don't seem to have a pic of the boat sitting on the trailer, but if your interested i can easily send you more pics directly or you can come see for yourself. I WANT A 4 WHEELER

description: I purchased this amazing boat this past season and really love the way it handles on the water. However, I'm 66 with a bad back and have trouble loading and unloading it. Native Watercrafts are superb boats, and I've purchased a 12' Slayer so that I can go off by myself.   The front hatch cover shown was an optional extra for this boat. Will include paddle for a no-haggle, full asking price sale. NO TRADES PLEASE CASH SALE ONLY Price lowered to $995 through New Years.... The Slayer fishing kayak series share simplicity, easy customization, and rock-solid stability. The Slayer features high/low seating positions for out-of-the-wind paddling and comfortable ergonomic fishing. Rails from bow to stern make customizing easy from simple to extreme. Fish and depth finders are a cinch to mount. A clean, open cockpit makes it a perfect  for stripping line while fly-fishing, and allows bait casters freedom of  movement when snatching that big Bass. description: The Great Bridge Fisherman's Association is sponsoring its 8th annual Fishing Flea Market on Saturday, March 11th, 2017 from 8:00 A.M. to 2:30 P.M. at the Chesapeake Conference Center, 700 Conference Center Drive, Chesapeake, VA.  New and used fresh and saltwater rods, reels, tackle, and other fishing items will be available for purchase at bargain prices.  We had over 100 vendor tables, and 3,000 happy shoppers last year.  If you have fishing equipment you would like to sell, we are currently accepting reservations from retail vendors and private individuals.  All tables are $50.00, and inside.  If you have a boat to sell, the fee is $3.00 per foot of BOAT length. These are the only fees vendors will need to pay.  FREE PARKING.  Admission is still only $3.00, with children 12 and under admitted for free.  Hot food and cold refreshments will be available for purchase.  An ATM will be available for use.  If you would like more information or a vendor agreement, please contact Butch Pierce at show contact info
title: BIG FISHING FLEA MARKET

description: Point 65 X-Ray, fair condition, 17 ft. long, weight of 41 lbs. A solid big water boat for extended trips or those looking to use it for a workout. This model is infusion-molded in kevlar/carbon. Equipped as standard with a deep retractable skeg and a day hatch. This would be great on the Rivanna Reservoir, Lake Monticello, Lake Anna, or Smith Mtn Lake!!! MAKE AN OFFER, ALL SERIOUS ONE CONSIDERD!!! As suitable for expedition paddlers as for entry level day-trippers, the shallow "V"-shaped hull offers excellent characteristics in rough weather, and minimizes yaw even when neither rudder nor skeg is deployed. The well defined chines permit easier turning with strong secondary stability while the distinctive foredeck-taper to avoid paddle impacts is a design characteristic of all Point 65°N kayaks. The cockpit is of key-hole design and suits all types of paddlers, its ergonomic seat providing excellent support. --from the Point 65 N website
